title: Meta Quest
content:
{{Short description|Line of virtual reality headsets}}
[[File:Meta Quest 3 display unit.jpg|thumb|The most recent model, the [[Meta Quest 3]], with [[Meta Quest 3 controllers|its controllers]]]]
The '''Meta Quest''', initially the '''Oculus Quest''' until 2022, is a line of [[Virtual reality headset|virtual reality headsets]] with [[augmented reality]] capabilities developed by [[Reality Labs]], a division of [[Meta Platforms]]. The first-generation [[Oculus Quest]] was developed by Oculus (then a brand of Facebook, now a division of Meta Platform known as Reality Labs) and released on May 21, 2019. Since then, Facebook (now Meta Platforms) has released new Quest models and [[Meta Horizon OS|Quest OS]] (now [[Meta Horizon OS|Horizon OS]]) updates. As of February 2023, over 50 million total Quest headsets have been sold.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Heath |first=Alex |date=2023-03-01 |title=Meta plans to sell first AR glasses in 2027 with ‘neural’ smartwatch |url=https://www.theverge.com/2023/2/28/23619730/meta-vr-oculus-ar-glasses-smartwatch-plans |access-date=2024-06-06 |website=The Verge |language=en}}</ref>

== Summary ==
Similar to its predecessor, [[Oculus Go]], the Quest line is a standalone device, that can run games and software wirelessly under the [[Android (operating system)|Android]]-based Quest operating system. It supports [[VR positional tracking|positional tracking]] with [[six degrees of freedom]], using internal sensors and an array of cameras in the front of the headset rather than external sensors, and supports hand tracking. The line also supports "Oculus Link", a feature that allows the Quest to be connected to a computer via [[USB]], enabling use with [[Oculus Rift]]-compatible software and games.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Lang |first=Ben |date=2020-05-14 |title=Oculus Quest Can Now Tether to PC with Its Included USB 2.0 Cable |url=https://www.roadtovr.com/oculus-link-usb-2-0-tether-quest-charging-cable/ |access-date=2024-06-06 |website=Road to VR |language=en-US}}</ref> It was the first device from Meta to support augmented reality via "Passthrough", which shows a view from the cameras when the user exits their designated boundary area known as "Guardian". Since the [[Meta Quest 3]], Quest models have supported color passthrough. 

The Quest series is the largest headset platform for virtual and augmented reality in the world as of 2024.
